short_summary: NM Confederation - Sewage Treatment Plant Replacement
description:
Trade Agreement: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
Tendering Procedures: All interested suppliers may submit a bid
Competitive Procurement Strategy: Best Overall  Proposal
Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement: No
Nature of Requirements: 

MV Confederation - Sewage Treatment Plant Replacement

T2012-220031/A

Public Works and Government Services Canada, on behalf of Transport Canada, requires a supplier specializing in marine sewage systems to disconnect, dismantle and remove the existing sewage treatment plant and supply, install and commission the necessary replacement equipment onboard the MV Confederation. It is intended that the replacement system be a complete  "turnkey" package that will include detailed specifications and the necessary drawings. It is understood that the Supplier will supply the equipment and have the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) Field Service Representative (FSR) present to oversee the commissioning, set to work and certification of the system. The new system must meet present regulations for the operating locations of the vessel. The successful supplier is responsible for all material and work required in completing the removal/disposal, supply, delivery and installation. Any sub contract work required to complete the installation will be the sole responsibility of the contractor. The vessel will be berthed in Caribou, NS or Pictou, NS during the installation phase. The new system must be capable of managing the same hydraulic load as the existing unit (17.5 m3/day). 

Work Location: Pictou, Nova Scotia

Project Dates: The removal and installation work is to be carried out from January 3rd, 2023 to February 27th, 2023.

Site Viewing and Bidders Conference:  There will be an optional site visit for interested Bidders.  The vessel is in-service which will require Bidders to embark on the vessel for the viewing as it sails from Caribou, NS to Wood Islands, PE and return. Vendors are encouraged to review the work requirements, along with the technical data package documentation, thoroughly in order to gain a full understanding of the requirements. Arrangements have been made for the site visit to be held on board MV Holiday Island on September 15th, 2022, beginning at 1300 local time at 3722 Highway 106, Caribou, Nova Scotia B0K 1H0. Bidders must communicate with the Contracting Authority no later than September 13th, 2022 to confirm attendance and provide the name(s) of the person(s) who will attend.

A bidders teleconference will be held with PWGSC and Transport Canada Authorities on September 16th, 2022 1:00PM ADT. Bidders must register with the Contracting Authority for the teleconference. 

Potential bidders are to contact the Contracting Authority to confirm teleconference attendance by 1:00PM ADT time Monday, September 14th, 2022.

There is no security requirement applicable to this Contract.

This requirement is subject to the provisions of the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

Trade agreement Exemptions: The requirement is exempt from the provisions of the Comprehensive Economic Trade Agreement (CETA), as per Annex 15A, Section e, Note 1c.

This Public Works and Government Services Canada office provides procurement services in both official languages of Canada. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

Inquiries are to be submitted to:
Chris Young
Supply Team Leader
Public Services and Procurement Canada
1713 Bedford Row
Halifax, Nova Scotia, B3J 3C9
Phone (902) 476-8829
E-mail: Christopher.Young@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca

IMPORTANT: This tender is part of Public Services and Procurement Canada‘s initiative to submit bid submission files electronically using epost Connect. Interested bidders should refer to Part 3 of the solicitation document entitled Offer Preparation Instructions for instructions on how to participate and submit their files electronically for this tender


T2012-220031/A
Young, Chris
Telephone No. - (902) 476-8829
Fax No. - (902) 496-5016


Delivery Date: Above-mentioned

The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.
